sent1: Israel’s Supreme Court blocked a bill banning Arab citizens from voting , citing constitutional concerns and dangerous precedents . Right - wing lawmakers claimed Arabs threaten Jewish society , but past similar laws were also struck down .
sent2: Israel’s Supreme Court rejected an attempt by the country’s legislature to limit its power , including on matters of religion and state . The court struck down a law passed last year that would have allowed the Knesset to override decisions by the court with a simple majority vote . " The Basic Law is intended to harm the status and standing of this court , ” Justice Hanan Melcer wrote in the ruling . " It is meant to ‘cut off the branch’ on which it sits . ” He said the court would not be able to fulfill its role as protector of civil rights if it were subjected to such political control . The decision was hailed by religious pluralism advocates , who had feared the legislation could be used to block their efforts to gain equal recognition under Israeli law .

sent2: In the 17th century , Portuguese Jesuit missionaries introduced the catechism to the Catholic communities of Goa . The practice was carried by the Goan diaspora to East Africa , where it remains popular today . This paper examines the performance of catechisms in a Goan community in Nairobi as a way of understanding how migrants negotiate their belonging within and outside of Kenya through religious practices . Through an ethnographic study of the catechism , I will explore how Goans make sense of their place in Kenyan society through a complex negotiation of religion , ethnicity and nationality .
